International Data Governance Framework

1. General Provisions

1.1. Purpose
This framework establishes principles for cross-border data governance
applicable to all participating organizations and jurisdictions.

1.2. Scope
This framework applies to the processing of personal data by any
organization that operates across national boundaries.

1.3. Application
Organizations shall implement these provisions within twelve months
of adoption by their governing authority.

2. Data Protection Principles

2.1. Lawful Processing
Data shall be processed lawfully, fairly, and in a transparent manner
in relation to the data subject.

2.2. Purpose Limitation
Data shall be collected for specified, explicit, and legitimate purposes
and not further processed in a manner incompatible with those purposes.

2.2.1. Consent Requirements
Processing shall require explicit consent of the data subject unless
one of the other lawful bases applies.

2.2.2. Legitimate Interest
Processing may be based on legitimate interests of the controller,
provided such interests are not overridden by the interests or
fundamental rights of the data subject.

2.3. Data Minimization
Data collected shall be adequate, relevant, and limited to what is
necessary in relation to the purposes for which it is processed.

3. Rights of Data Subjects

3.1. Right of Access
Data subjects have the right to obtain confirmation as to whether
personal data concerning them is being processed.

3.2. Right to Rectification
Data subjects have the right to obtain rectification of inaccurate
personal data without undue delay.

3.3. Right to Erasure
Data subjects have the right to obtain the erasure of personal data
concerning them without undue delay.

4. Definitions

"Personal data" means any information relating to an identified or
identifiable natural person.

"Processing" means any operation or set of operations which is performed
on personal data or on sets of personal data.

"Controller" means the natural or legal person which determines the
purposes and means of the processing of personal data.

"Processor" means a natural or legal person which processes personal
data on behalf of the controller.

"Data subject" means an identified or identifiable natural person.

5. Enforcement

5.1. Supervisory Authority
Each participating jurisdiction shall designate a supervisory authority
responsible for monitoring compliance with this framework.

5.2. Penalties
Infringements of this framework may result in administrative fines
as determined by the supervisory authority.
